The assassin- ation of Darius by Bessus, the satrap of Bactria, left the Persian Empire without a head, but there were still the great Eastcrn provinces to subdue. These Alexander, after executing Bessus, proceeded to conquer, and not content with this, invaded India, defeated and captured Porus, one of the native kings, and would have attempted the subjugation of the whole country, had not his soldiers refused to follow him. Accordingly at the Acesines he had to return (326), and died at Babylon in 323. Alexander was a King, General, Soldier, and Explorer, and excellcd in each capacity.
